Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" .
Murkowski condemns Trump’s pardons to Jan. 6 rioters who assaulted police
President Donald Trump continues to face criticism from Republican and Democratic senators over his decision on Tuesday to issue pardons to roughly 1,500 criminal defendants involved in the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol.
Sen. Lisa Murkowski (R-Alaska), one of the seven Republican senators who voted to convict Trump in his second impeachment trial, is the latest to express public disapproval, particularly for the pardons for those convicted of assaulting police officers.
“The Capitol Police officers are the backbone of Congress — every day they protect and serve the halls of democracy. I strongly denounce the blanket pardons given to the violent offenders who assaulted these brave men and women in uniform,” Murkowski wrote on X.
She joins a growing chorus of senators who have condemned Trump’s decision, including Republican Sens. Mitch McConnell (Kentucky) — who said, “No one should excuse violence. And particularly violence against police officers” — and Thom Tillis (North Carolina), who said he “just can’t agree” with Trump’s clemency moves.
